t: “They*pn have greatly oppressed me from my youth,” let*ld Israel say;
“they*ln have greatly oppressed me from my youth, but*ld they have not gained the victory over me.
Plowmen*ln have plowed my back and*ld made their furrows long.
But*ln the Lord*s is righteous; he*ld has cut me free from the cords of the wicked.”
May*pn all who hate Zion be*ld turned back in shame.
May*ln they be like grass on the roof, which*ld withers before it can grow;
a*ln reaper cannot fill his hands with it, nor*ld one who gathers fill his arms.
May*ln those who pass by not say to them, “The*ld blessing of the Lord*s be on you; we*ld bless you in the name of the Lord.”*s
